item.title: Semantic Alchemists: SkipGram and Continuous Bag Of Words (CBOW)
item.description:
• Lnaguage models require vector representations of words to capture semantic relationships.
  • Earlier than 2010s, models used word count based vector representations that captured only the frequency of words. For Example, one-hot encoding. THe problems:
  1. The Curse of Dimensionality
  2. Lack of meaning

In 2011, At Google, Mikolov et al. introduced Word2Vec, which used a shallow neural network to learn vector representations of words. The best part was that it could create much denser relationships between words than prior models and it was unsupervised.
